text.section: In this Part IV of this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Electronic health record" means an electronic record of health-related information on an individual that:
Includes patient demographic and clinical health information; and
Has the capacity to:
Provide clinical decision support;
Support physician order entry;
Capture and query information relevant to health care quality; and
Exchange electronic health information with and integrate the information from other sources.

section.section: "Health benefit plan" means a hospital or medical policy, contract, or certificate issued by a carrier.

"Health care provider" means:
A person who is licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized under the Health Occupations Article to provide health care in the ordinary course of business or practice of a profession or in an approved education or training program; or
A facility where health care is provided to patients or recipients, including:
"Health care provider" does not include a health maintenance organization as defined in § 19-701 of this title.

text.section: "Health information exchange" means a statewide infrastructure that provides organizational and technical capabilities to enable the electronic exchange of health information between health care providers and other health services organizations authorized by the Commission.
"Management service organization" means an organization that offers one or more hosted electronic health record solutions and other management services to multiple health care providers.

section.section: "State-regulated payor" means a carrier issuing or delivering health benefit plans in the State.
"State-regulated payor" does not include a managed care organization as defined in Title 15, Subtitle 1 of this article.
